Dear Harry,
 
First you execute everyone who is mean or deliberately annoying. Then you
execute everyone with no social skills of any kind. Then ....
Oops, you meant "test execution". Sorry :-)
 
The order in which JUnit executes tests is not defined. I had bad
experiences with tests that were dependent on each other and so I've done
what I can in JUnit to encourage people to write independent tests. In
practice, the execution order is stable but perhaps we should randomize
it... The standard test runners execute tests sequentially but I've heard of
several that execute them in parallel for performance.
 
Regards,
 
Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute


  _____  

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
huaishih_wen
Sent: Monday, August 28, 2006 9:06 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Execution Order



How does junit determine the order of execution for test methods?
How does junit determine the order of execution for test cases added 
to a test suite?
Does junit execute test methods/test cases swquentially or 
concurrently?

Thanks.

Harry Wen
